review: I went with my boyfriend and it was pretty busy there. The hostess let us know there was about a 10 min wait, but we only waited about 4 min. We were seated and ordered right away. I ordered my favorite, the bonzai burger and half of the burger was missing. The only thing on the burger was lettuce and mayo. The fries looked really burnt. The waitress and the manager brought me a new burger. Mistakes happen, didn't ruin my night and appreciated the manager talking to me about it without me asking for her to. The one thing I didn't like though, was we had to wait a really long time for the waitress to take our check to pay. She was cleaning up and seemed more interested in leaving to go home than to allow us to pay and leave. But overall, not a horrible experience.

The food here is average at best. We ordered chips and guacamole for an app. The chips were stale and the guac had a layer of brown on it from sitting. Burgers were okay but as others have stated the fries aren't worth the free unlimited amount. Theres better burger places in town. Try them first.
Long wait just to get seated. ..but otherwise normal red robins.

Same as the other ones.  It is good.  Not great.  A bit heavy on the sauces, but people like that.  Salads are actually decent if you want an alternative.  Free refills on normal drinks.  Not sold that this is the best of its kind, but solid and you know what you are getting.  There are TV's for sports while eating.  bathrooms are a bit small, but clean
I go to red robin very offen and love the burger and the many topping that is offer...and the service is very good

I find that the food quality at the Red Robin chain can be inconsistent...sometimes very good burgers and sometimes meh. I have only been to this local 2x and it has been good but not great, both visits. I like that you can customize to your delight. Bottomless fries and onion ring tower are good. It is definitely "family friendly" casual here, my kids enjoy coming for their "special occasions" like report card days and birthdays. And their cocktails, while pricey, are ginormous, and usually pretty good too.

Well, that was a horrible experience. My wife and I were headed to the movies last week and decided to grab a burger at Red Robin before our show. Neither of us had ever been there before, but we were expecting a Five Guys or Shake Shack type of experience (more upscale fast food place). We were surprised to find out this was an actual sit down restaurant with an insane menu that seemed to rival The Cheesecake Factory in length and random offerings. But that wasn't the issue.  It was a Thursday night and not terribly crowded, but we were seated in a corner by the kitchen door and waited almost 10 minutes for our waitress to come greet us. We both picked out burgers that sounded good and had been made to look mouthwatering by those food photographers who created the menu. We both eat our burgers medium rare and when mine arrived, it was still cold in the center. Once that was fixed, we both noticed that our burgers tasted like they had been doused in liquid smoke to give some grill flavor and clearly had been branded with grill lines (I mean, I don't expect them to cook on an ACTUAL grill, but don't patronize me with grill lines...). For a place that proclaims itself as a home for "Gourmet Burgers", these were major issues. The burgers and toppings on them were extremely salty as well and beyond everything I already mentioned, made them essentially inedible. The fries were crispy and apparently unlimited, but that was no where near enough to make this place worth it.  Reeeed Robinnn... Yuck  [sung to theme song]

You can't love the good food without indulging in the bad. Sometimes a greasy burger is all you need to conquer a busy Saturday afternoon. When we arrived a party of 17 was seated in the dining room so we opted for a more casual bar dining experience. There was an open table and we were greeted promptly by our server who brought us the two pints of beer we ordered (Sam Adams Boston Lager & Winter Lager).  While the menu is quite large and packed with countless options, it's hard to stray from the standard options. Although, one time I did try the southwest grilled chicken salad -- the fried jalapeños were probably the highlight. Anyway, that day my bf and I ordered the chicken sandwich and the patty melt to share.  "Some pink or no pink" is their attempt at differentiating themselves from the fully cooked fast food patty. I go for some pink and would qualify their burgers as juicy because they're greasy and topped with some extras like a dressing or mayo. I really enjoyed both the dishes we had. I was looking for salty, hearty food and I got it. The patty melt burger was on warm, buttered marble rye, topped with swiss, 1000 Island Dressing, and caramelized onions. The chicken sandwich has bit of a southern chicken sandwich flare with the seasoned batter and the pickles that top the sandwich. Not for the everyday meal, but a solid option for lunch after a night of drinking or when you have to bear a day of shopping around Jefferson Rd.

Reasonably priced burgers, plenty of options, and unlimited steak fries, what's not to like?  On those days where you want something better than a 5 Guys burger, but you don't feel like going to a higher end burger joint like Gate House, Red Robin delivers.  You're not going to come out of the restaurant feeling blown away, but you'll most likely be satisfied.  I've had most of the burgers on their menu, as well as some of their specialty/limited-offer burgers, and they've all been pretty good.  My personal favorite is the Burnin' Love Burger. They offer the choice of "some pink or no pink".  Like any self-respecting person, I always go with some pink, but even if they were to cook it well done, there's usually enough grease to keep it juicy.  The only time I've complained about the saltiness is when I've substituted the turkey burger for the beef; I stopped that practice shortly after realizing the seasoning they use on the turkey burgers is the equivalent of drinking sea water.  The great thing about Red Robin is their unlimited steak fries and bottomless drinks.  I recommend going for the garlic parmesan fries to add a little more flavor to them, and while you're at it, order some campfire sauce.  You'll thank me later.   Most places have bottomless beverages, but bottomless root beer floats is a whole other thing!  On a hot summer day, stop in at lunch time and just indulge for a few. While Red Robin is a sit down restaurant, my favorite place to eat is right at the bar.  Whether I go by myself or with some friends, I have always received great service at the bar and what goes better with a big, juicy burger than a cold beer?

One of my favorite chain burger restaurants in town. The reasonable prices, variety of burgers and bottomless fries keep bringing me back. A good burger and tall beer serve as the perfect reward after a long day of work.  Like another reviewer mentioned, Red Robin is a good compromise between a fast food burger (ie. 5 guys) and a gourmet burger (ie. Good Luck). It won't break the bank and you're almost guaranteed to be full afterwards. At the same time, Red Robin offers a casual but comfortable dining atmosphere.  At this Henrietta location, I've found the service to be consistently good. There are plenty of tables, so you seldom have to wait even at peak hours. Unlike some other trendier restaurants serving gourmet burgers, the noise level is acceptable. Parking is plentiful and easy too.  The burgers are cooked to order. With 10+ different types of burgers, it's hard to choose just one. My go-to burgers are the Royal Red Robin (Fried Egg and Bacon), Whiskey River (BBQ sauce and crispy onion straws) and the Banzai (Teriyaki sauce and grilled pineapple). If you love hamburgers and are unfamiliar with Red Robin, it's definitely worth checking out!

Blegh.  I tried Red Robin for the first time expecting a higher-end fast-food deliciously-greasy-burger experience.  Wrong.  Instead I got bad service, salty food, and mediocre meat.  I won't come back.

I've been to this red robin many times. This last time (today for lunch) warranted a review, because it was such a strange experience. I dont think it has anything to do with the actual restaurant, but new changes that i assume were brought on by corporate policy change. First thing is, the menu change. More burgers added, but they are astronomically priced. Wanted to try one of them but for $15, I'm not biting. So I order my tride and true affordable bleu ribbon burger.  It came out on a plate (GASP!), unwrapped (OH NO!) and with about 5 single fries accompanying it (WTF?!) So i gobble the burger and fries and after about 5 minutes my fries are all gone. So I order some more (thank god they're bottomless!) Well, that was disappointing. Usually what happens is, I eat some fries, order some more, and take the rest home for my poor grad student dinner (or next day's lunch). This time, though, I received a basket of no more than 10 single fries. My whole table of 5 stared at the basket, confused. THIS was bottomless? I suppose I could have asked for even more fries, but I'm not a jerk.Instead, I will just eat my 10 fries for dinner, and try out the real gourmet burger place down the street next time I crave a burger.

I've been here before, but the service today was so bad I feel compelled to write a review.  Food is always pretty good: burgers and onion ring tower rock. But when the place is busy, it's difficult to get anything "off menu". I politely asked them to change the tv channel so my two young kids didn't have to watch boxing. The employee forgot and I had to ask someone else.  Then they forgot my 4 year-old son's mac and cheese! My wife had asked for a side of mayo with her order and that was not there as well. The 5 minutes we had to wait for someone to scoop the mac in a bowl was way too long. (I've worked in restaurants for years all through college - I know the process.) So, my wife couldn't start, my son had nothing, and they didn't even come back to give us an update. We were all waiting and watching our food get cold, and there was no comp. On a $50 bill, they should have taken the $5 mac n cheese off.  That was just the climax of a poor situation that had already existed. The service was slow and at times non-existent. I've come before in the middle of a rush where the service was merely subpar, but today was at the tail end of a rush and they wouldn't have done better if they had the food made instantaneously from the Star Trek machine. I'll go back for the burgers, but I know I'll be treated like a number and I'll have to be a "squeaky wheel" in order to get decent service.

Excellent burger place.  The onion rings with campire sauce is outstanding!  When you ask for your burger with "some pink" they give it to you that way. I also like how they have a bunless option with their burgers where they will wrap up in lettuce for you.

Id just like to start off by saying that the service that we got here was phenomenal. We were seated right away, and the server had our drinks over super fast.  The woman that waited on us was super friendly, and even let me get a kids meal (a big plus in my book at places because I like the smaller portions). Food came out super quick, and was tasty and hot. We were offered more steak fries (they're bottomless which is awesome!) perfectly timed through our meal.  This is the part that made me absolutely give this place 5 stars. While waiting, I registered for their loyalty club on my phone, and gave our server the new membership number with the bill. She comes back to the table to tell me there was an issue, but asks for my phone number to try it again. That doesn't work, and the manager himself comes over to our table to apologize about the error, let me know that I would still be receiving credit for that visit and the perks for joining the program, and gave me a paper with more info. I found that to be pretty awesom

The food is good but the service at the Henrietta location is going to hell in the fast lane. For the past 9 months my bf and I have been sitting at the bar to avoid screaming kids and poor table service, and it's been a pretty ok experience. Last night we had my teenage son with us so bar was not an option. Our server didn't show up for over 5 minutes, neglected to take my drink order after overselling the root beer floats to the guys, then never brought out our order of onion rings. The apologies were rolling when we brought it to her attention after our meals arrived. The manager made a cursory and disingenuous stop to apologize. Looking around, I noticed that most of the staff looks older and tired. Time to hire some fresh, younger and eager staff and turn the ship around. I think we may make the drive to Webster next time and hope it's better. We like the burgers and extras at Red Robin but the aggravation is getting hard to overlook.
Best place for cheap burgers , also gluten Free options too! I love coming here all the time .

I used to luv this place but the service has been horrible lately. This is the 3rd time we had bad experience.  Last Night our food was cold & fries were disgusting. We asked to get them replaced & it took them 30 minutes to bring out food out. Then we got half ass apology from the manager. The waitress then messed up our bill & didn't even return my credit card. Their servers are not well trained & they need to staff appropriately. I am so disappointed & would never been going back their. I wish the manager took more responsibility

Good gourmet burger. If you are a burger fan, just go for the chomp! I had once ordered a deep fried cod, which wasn't the greatest due to a bitter side taste - maybe the fish was the culprit. (Loses 1 * due to this) Overall the best burger I have had till date. The fried onion rings act like great catalysts for the already great burger! I am not a great beverage fan but have tasted the freckle lemonade and would recommend it! Let's go to Red Robin

I've been eating at this Red Robin literally since it first opened something like close to a decade ago.  It was the first non-fast food burger joint in town outside of the more ritzy ones at the time (I'm afraid Good Luck and Gate House were both a bit too fancy for me when I was in college..!), and was always an awesome place to go to with friends for huge celebrations or just for a nice dinner out.   Of all things, I'm happy to say that service has not changed at all since the early 2000s.  The wait staff has always been wonderful, helpful, and funny all these past 10 years and continues to be an A+ team in my mind.  Without even having to ask, they bring you "refills" of fries and the bottomless root beer floats, and they're just always available to take care of you and make you feel welcome.  Even if an order somehow gets messed up, they take care of it without as much as a peep of complaining and have always been extremely lovely people in pretty much all of my experiences. On the other side of the business, the food quality unfortunately has taken a huge nose dive in the past few years.  Thick burgers that used to be caramelized, juicy, and full of meatiness now taste like the standard cheap 80/20 patties you can find in any supermarket.  Crispy fried onion strings that used to have texture and flavor now are smaller, floppy, and soggy.  Toppings that used to be fresh now seem day-old (at best) and have typically been overcooked or dried out in my recent experiences.  The food has just lost its sparkle.  I understand the greater business making cuts to still show a profit in the inflating economy, but it's such a shame that what used to be really delicious burgers have turned into perfectly bland and unimpressive average fare.   I'm sure I'll continue to frequent this location from time to time, but I truly wish they could raise their food game again.  Return to your former glory, Red Robin!

After being seated for 15 minutes a server stopped by to apologize in the delay and that he would get me something to drink and my server would be right along..   that server never showed... another 10 minutes goes by and the first server shows and again apologizes for the mix up.. and took my order which was a pretty simple order a bacon cheeseburger fries and a side salad. . 45 minutes later my food arrives.... I couldn't do anything at this point but ask to speak with the manager..  he was a nice apologetic man..  took full responsibility for everything... accept for my cold food.... I never felt like a guest but rather more of an inconvenience  to the staff and that goes right down the line  from hostess to finally manager... C'mon as much as I appreciate the 5.00 off... I would rather someone just come up to me and not blow smoke up my ass and just say we messed up and I will make sure this is addressed  and corrected.... can I personally get you something??  Would've been a nice touch... but today red robin it sucked!!

If you are in the mood for a burger. You should come to red robin. It's been some time since I've dined at red's, and there has been a lot of change to their menu. Good change! The variety is wider, the flavors are bolder, and even offer more healthy options and substitutes for those who don't want to waste their entire daily calorie intake in one sitting. I was pleasantly surprised that they now offer bottomless sweet potatoes and broccoli!! I had a side of each - both very enjoyable. Don't have the broccoli though if you're on a date, if you catch my drift ;)  Normally I always get the chicken bruschetta burger - it is so good! Last night I decided to go with the beef and ordered the blue ribbon burger. I devoured that bad boy. 6 oz juicy burger with blue cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, aioli sauce on an onion bun.  We had the pretzel bites as an app. I just remembered, bc I never order apps, lol. They were awesome though - glad I did. Only $5! The beer cheese dip was awesome! Lots of flavor and the dough of the pretzel was perfect, not too salty either.  After all that, I didn't leave anything to spare. A rare thing to happen. Must have been that good!

Good atmosphere and good food. We got seated within 10 minutes.  I didn't like how this location doesn't bring out the endless fries as an appetizer.  I didn't ask only because they brought it out at another location so I thought they were going to.  I got a burger and fries. Nothing really stood out from another restaurant.  The only thing that I wish this location had was a home style bbq sauce which I had at the other location.  I was really looking forward to the sauce and actually recommended it to my fiancé and when we tried the bbq sauce that came out it was just regular bbq. Slight disappointment but I'll probably be back.  Note to the restaurant: Please get house bbq at this location. Thanks!

Not impressed. They just can't seem to pull it together here. Second time and problems both times. Today I asked for a monster shake. Got a regular. Then we asked for a Royal Red Robin burger, on ciabatta, with cheddar cheese and some pink (medium well).  We got a burger with American cheese, no pink, on a regular role.  Manager just stands in one spot and did not make any effort to engage or address issues.  We waited 15 minutes, and fries alternated between soggy and dry.  It's a burger people. Should not be this hard.

There's nothing special about the food here. It's alright food but it didn't blow me away. Also I've had to wait a lot to get my food every time I've gone. If you enjoy burgers or basic sandwiches then this is the place to come for cheap food but be prepared to wait.
After going to red robin in April, I complained on the red robin website and I was sent a $20 gift card.  That was very nice. I do typically enjoy their food and the staff is typically friendly.

At Jefferson Rd Red Robin with my family this evening (8/10) and the food is really good. The restaurant is always clean, the staff is friendly but there is inconsistency in response to refills (fries & drinks). I believe everyone appreciates fas service, especially, this of is with children. On this night we observed other parties receiving refills and follow up visits where we were seated and waited a while until our waitress returned. A bit disappointing having to look for your server instead of enjoying the meal and each other's company. It's difficult to want to return when there are many options available.

I love Red Robin (yummm!)! Came here with my mom and sister after we had moved my sister into her new apartment at RIT. I got one of the lemonades (freckled?) and my sister got the poppin' (pear) both were very sweet and yummy. I love the bottomless fries (pro-tip, the container literally has no bottom) because I don't fill up on them before my burger and I can always ask for more and then take them home. This place has some many burgers that I have yet to try but I wasn't very hungry so I had the chicken tenders which were good. They also have some pretty interesting sauces besides ranch and barbecue. My sister got chipotle-something or other and really enjoyed it. Our server Jazmin (sp?) was the best! All in all, a great meal at a great chain.

We never have bad service here. It can get crowded. I also miss the old garlic fries. Of note, they now have tablets at all of the tables. Convenient for paying your check by credit card.  However, they also charge $1.99 to play games. My kids tapped a few buttons because they didn't realize there was a fee attached. My guess is most parents won't until after the fact and then they will let the charge go (like I did).

We were disappointed in our burgers and our overall experience tonight. We frequent Red Robbin maybe once a year and it looks like the Henrietta location went through a face lift at the cost of food quality. My hubby and I both got burgers but they just were not as tasty as usual. The patty's where very thin and ingredients not very fresh. We had to ask twice for silverware, napkins and ketchup. The fries were not crispy at all. I sent my sweet potato fries back and requested regular fries and was still charged the up charge. The computer system at the table seems impersonal and is a distraction. We will not be returning.

This place has excellent service and has a very modern interior, their  atmosphere and design are both excellent but their burgers are pretty average compared to other chains, alias their clam chowder is excellent at least :)

Not the biggest fan of this Red Robin as I have always had poor service. The waitress literally rolled her eyes at us just taking a simple drink order (Water and Sodas). I am a fan of the food as a fast/casual, quick idea. I really enjoy the onion rings which are always so nice and crispy - I love dipping in bbq sauce. I rarely get burgers when I go out so I can't speak much to theirs but I like the whiskey grilled bbq chicken sandwich with some avocado. Most recently the grilled chicken was juicy and flavorful. I enjoy the steak fries which are endless and would like to try their sweet potato fries. My friend got a side salad that looked lacking in veggie toppings but fresh. The root beer floats here are frosty and satisfying! I had forgotten how much I love root beer floats. The milk shakes are huge and look like they could be a meal in itself. They also have some spiked shakes that sound worth trying.  They have a great rewards program, sign up and get a free burger during your birthday month. With my most recent visit I noted that now they have the Tablet setup on table to get staff, order and pay. Maybe this might be an upgrade from some of the service I have had here in the past.

I ordered a ghost pepper burger, and while at first I felt it was small, it did fill me up. The bottomless fries did help in that department, and while it was cool to have that, the portions were small (for fries). The service was quick, with my brother and I spending about 40 minutes total in there. The workers were also nice, constantly checked to see how we were doing. Would recommend at least once.

This is one of my go to places because it is one of the only places I can eat French fries with my severe wheat allergy.  They have gluten free buns and a separate cooking area/fryer for my food.  I have never had an issue with cross contamination and the burgers are amazing!!

This is not a Red Robbin I would ever come to again. There was a 45 min wait for a table. We had the nerve to order a salad here. It came with wilted Iceberg salad... ewww.  My DGB burger was dry and looked like a prwviously frozen patty. Hmmm. No thanks.

We went on a busy Friday night. My chicken burger was good to taste. The boneless wings me and my partner ordered was tasty. But my partner's burger had very greasy fries and the oil seemed to be stale, not fresh. It was smelling stale. We weren't happy with the fries she got. However, the sweet potato fries I had were not having the same problem. So, giving it a 2.5 stars here. I'd be cautious when going here next time.

I think it's easier for me to get seated since I usually like to end up at the bar and order food directly from there. I see a lot of complaints about the wait, but it's also an incredibly busy location to eat at! lol of course it's going to be difficult to eat in on weekends... Besides that I've always had excellent service and I've not once been disappointed with my food, always hot always tasty!

Normally my experiences at this red robin location have been, for the most part, very enjoyable. My latest visit however, was much, much, MUCH less so...With several other empty booths open, the person who sat us had to sit us right on top of the most obnoxious, disrespectful and loud people they could find. Generally this is a practice I'm used to when it comes to restaurants, since they love to cluster everyone together when it's not as busy, but seriously, would it hurt them to be mindful of the people they're seating you by? But that wasn't even the worst of it. The lady who was serving these noisy, rude people, swiped our wireless table order screen for theirs, which apparently wasn't working. This was long after we'd ordered and our total was on the screen, so basically we ended up having our whole order messed up from this. If that wasn't enough, it took them a good 10-15 minutes to rectify this, and mind you there was nobody else there in that area so it's not like they were swamped. OH, and while we were trying to enjoy our food, this was when they were having the trouble with the machine that the other server had dumped on us. So they were at the table THE ENTIRE TIME trying to fix it...not even bothering to take it someplace else so we could eat in peace after the noisy people finally left. Just an all around terrible experience, the server who snatched our screen had no consideration or foresight on what it'd do to our order...or she simply didn't care, more concerned with the loud people she was serving.  needless to say I'm not going back to this location anytime soon, if ever...I couldn't even enjoy the food as the atmosphere was horrible, they have no concept of how to seat people so they can enjoy their meal if it's not packed...
I will never go again. I went once and got a hair in my burger then I sent it back and got a fingernail in my burger. It was outrageous

Stopped here for lunch for my fist experience, restaurant was quite busy however the bar area was available. Bar area had lots of high tables and booths, as well as seats at the bar. Loved all the cool decor on the walls and ceiling. Beautiful glass bottle structure overhead and a united states wall poster with beer stickers from the best beers in that area ( go Brooklyn beer!) I had a bacon cheeseburger and regular fries. I heard the seasoning on the fries are very popular, I was excited to try these.....but for me they were just ok. Not something I would go out of my way to buy.  The menu had so many options, I will be back to try some of their specility drinks and desserts!

Its been about 10 years since I have been to a Red Robin. Lines at Chipotle were out the door, so I figured I'd switch it up!  This establishment is quiet large for a "family friendly" place.  Huge floor to ceiling chalkboard for the kids to write on. From the hostess station I noticed the very busy dining room.  Opted to sit in the bar area as there was not a sole there.  Lots of TV's for you sports fans out there.  Our server was friendly.  I ordered the the guacamole bacon Swiss burger (hold the tomatoes).  I remembered not being a fan of the seasoning on the fries, or the fact that they were steak fries.  The waitress was accommodating and placed my order for "well done fries, no seasoning".  They were crispy!  Also, I inquired via memory of bottomless fries. She said, "Yes, and she would put some in right away".  Way to be proactive!   I noticed, just as Andrew noted, the Lettuce tasted a day too old.  There was not too much guac on the burger itself, but from what i tasted, it wasn't bad. Only thing I did not enjoy was the cashing out/bill portion of my experience.  We asked the server for the check and she pointed to the Stand-up mini ipad.  Apparently you cash yourself out on this dirty machine that every man, woman, and child has touched.  What happened to this part of the service Red Robin?  = (      In the future I will have to try a shake and their onion rings.  And maybe that spicy jalapeno margarita.

Met my brother for late lunch yesterday so it was not as crowded as it normally is during peak times, no wait! Service was great, food was fresh, hot and delicious (I get the burger with the Pineapple on it, never remember the name) but it is so good! Love it! Price is fair, free drink refills, and bottomless fries. You now pay at the table, which is kind of a pain, as it did not work right even after waitress tried to figure it out. This place is also kid friendly so extremely loud & noisy, usually I opt for the bar area, but sat in dining area as it wasn't crowded. So if you want a hot delicious burger, fries, and drink for a fair price in a noisy restaurant head over to this place.

I'm not a big fan of burgers, so of course I was hesitant when a friend invited me to go out and eat. We went as a small group, and each of us ordered a burger and fries. Service was quick; we got a table almost immediately and the waitress was quite friendly. Each table had a little tablet device set up. You can order, call for a staff member, and even play games (for a fee) as you wait for your food. I ordered a medium rare Royal Robin Burger, I believe. The over easy egg was perfectly done and allowed for a lot of the drippy yolk to smother the sandwich. I expected the burger to be super dry, but to my surprise, it was actually extremely moist, yet still hard to chew somehow. I didn't really like the burger, to say the least. What I did enjoy were the bottomless herb fries I ordered. They were perfectly seasoned, and they tasted so good that I got addicted pretty quickly and began to stuff myself on them when I got tired of the burger. After a while, my friends started rotating fry baskets around to sample other flavors. For dessert, I had a cheesecake. Smooth, creamy, and topped with a dollop of whipped cream and strawberries for a kick of acidity. To summarize, everything was fine, but I ironically didn't enjoy the menu items that this chain is apparently known for. XD

I really enjoy lunch at Red Robin and usually sit in the bar area where the TVs are huge and are always tuned to ESPN, which is fine by me.  The Tavern Double is my favorite burger and is a heck of a deal at $6.99, considering that they include unlimited fries or your choice of healthier options at no additional cost. In order to cut a few calories I skip their special burger sauce and substitute the house salad for the fries.  So, for about the same price as McDonalds or Wendy's, you get a great meal in a civilized and relaxing atmosphere with the opportunity to catch up on the world of sports while on your lunch break. Not bad! The service is always friendly too.

Consistently good service and food - beware of server Sydney - was a terrible experience and we missed our plans despite planning 120 minutes for dinner!  She forgot to put our order in, never checked up, and no drink refills.

Updated review: unfortunately I have to change my five stars to four stars because the last three times I've been here the service has been sub par. This time we came we had to ask twice for silverware and napkins to even begin eating our meal. When we received our meal it was just slapped down on the table and the girl left not asking if we needed anything, nor did anyone come around until we were finished with the meal to ask if we needed anything and if our meal was all right. We had to ask a random waiter walking by that wasn't ours to grab us some campfire sauce and silverware. I so love this place and it's food however your service gets me every time. An extremely large party of our came to Red Robin after a gathering @ RIT, in talking about 30 people and it was about 2 hours before close. The staff was EXTREMELY accommodating and kind when more and more people showed up. We took over the whole booth tables across the wall with another group filling in 3 big red tables and another booth in the back. Service: Speedy and on their game! Our drinks never got down to slurping up melted ice, nor did the endless fries ever see an empty tray. There was one mix up of buffalo and BBQ wings, but it was fixed and out within 5 minutes. The orders all came out correct and in record time. They even sang for our friends birthday!  Food:  Fried pickles- not overly fried, dried out or cold! Also the CAMPFIRE SAUCE that comes with it... fan-flipping-tastic! It tastes exactly like Chik-fil-A's Chik-fil-A sauce which in NY we don't have here, so I can get my CFA fix!! Al. Peppercorn Burger-  Crispyyy (the way I like it!) applewood smoked bacon, melted pepper-jack cheese, a.1. peppercorn spread, crispy onion straws (not soggy) and fresh tomatoes on an onion bun (not overbearingly oniony). I took off the tomatoes-I'm not a fan of them, however I was fan-girling over this choice! If you like cracked pepper anything, you'll love this! I get my burgers well done ( I know, sue me..), but it wasn't dry at all which can happen when cooking the burger to no red.  Fries: Bottomless, steak cut, cooked to perfection- not dry, soggy or too crispy! There are plenty of dipping sauces made in house like the Campfire sauce I totally recommend! Overall: I will be back because of the Campfire sauce and the amazing service! The burger was great don't get me wrong, but these two things stood out to me the most!

Maybe I made a bad choice. But I was totally unimpressed by my Mushroom Burger aka Bland Burger.  If the mushrooms weren't canned, the sure taste like it. And the beef had very little taste.  I also ordered house salad instead of fries.  It arriveD 1 minute before the burger which was accompanied by, guess what, more of the same salad.  I inquired, and the explanation was that it was bottomless salad!  If it was good salad, I might have even made it through the first portion, but it wasn't.   Beer was good.  Service was friendly.  But if I want a tasty, unhealthy burger, I'll go to Five Guys1
This is my girlfriends favorite place to go. They are always friendly and nice. Services varies by server but the managers are always there waiting to help when needed. No complaints.
Good food, Good Service,  My Wife Loved it. Nice place to grab awesome Burgers and Drinks. Prices are great too.

I have always been satisfied with this and other Rochester-area Red Robins in terms of great food that fits their niche, and friendly-if-scripted customer service. However the last - and perhaps final - time I ate at their Jefferson Road location, Saturday 11/5/2016, while the food was up to the usual standards, the service, from when we walked in the door to when we left, was off-the-chart awful. Surly hostesses with their backs to guests entering, and making no effort to turn around and greet customers.  Incompetent and unfriendly servers.  Mistakes and omissions in orders. I documented this to their online customer service and received a courtesy gift card.  But as to the specifics of my complaint, neither "Monica R" nor "Kim A" from their corporate Guest Support were of any help, saying that they needed "more information" to investigate - I had told them the time we were in the restaurant, time we paid, that we paid by their own electronic kiosk system, where we sat, and what our tab was, then furnished them with our Red Robin Rewards card number.  What more did they need? I have long felt this place was a 3/4-star experience.  Five for the food, less because the scripted patter is off-putting to me, but they always took good care of my family. Because I had an abysmal experience there, and received no meaningful followup from either their national Guest Services, or their local manager, I want to put this issue out in public. I hope for their sake that our November 5 was an aberration.
What an awesome place! My first time here didn't disappoint. Great service. Food was outstanding and the beer was cold! What more could you ask for?

It is rare that Adam and I eat beef, but when we want burgers this is one of the places we always go to.   We are always seated quickly and the staff is always friendly.   Our food always comes fresh and piping hot. We are always happy with all that we get. Our burgers are always great and I love the fries and that they are bottomless. The red robin spice is amazingggg and perfect to place all over your fries.   I am always happy here and will continue to go to Red Robin for burger hankerings.

How can you not like Red Robin? If you're in the mood for a chain, Red Robin really manages to do everything that a chain does well while also feeling kind of like a family-owned business. Unlimited fries are my JAM. (Though if you're feeling differently, they also have things like sweet potato fries for an upcharge, or unlimited broccoli.) And their burgers are great. Best value is the tavern doubles which are a little smaller than a typical burger, but when you're doing fries like I am, it is so worth it. Their "typical" gourmet burgers are great, too, and then if you're in the mood for something more their specialty burgers are bomb. The best is the DGB. Higher quality meat. Cooked to perfection. Just amazing. Order it and you'll thank me later. In terms of appetizers, there's a bunch to please a crowd. My go tos are the Onion Rings (the breading on them is AMAZING) that come in two sizes depending on if you're a big or small party and the (recently re-added) northern poutine fries. Another family fave are the pretzel bites. This Red Robin has workers who are great, really nice, and the best part is they neither judge you for getting that extra basket of fries nor do they rush you out. LOVE it and definitely need to work it back into the rotation.

I have been to other Red Robins. This is beyond the worst one I have ever been to. The first thing upon entering was the noise. It was so loud. Not a comfortable place to relax and eat lunch. Anyways that is not a deal breaker for me if the food is good. I have to say the service was fine. My waitress was nice. However the food was terrible. The fries were undercooked and soggy. I had the garlic fries and they were unevenly seasoned with some fries drenched in garlic and some with barley any. I could only stomach about half. The bruschetta chicken is one of my usual favorites. However the chicken was burnt and it had a real funny taste to it. I ended up eating my roll without the chicken. I had drinks too. They do have yummy cocktails. However over 7 bucks for a drink at a cheap place is just overpriced. Lunch for 2 was 50 bucks and a stomachache. Not returning.

Are you ready to break out of your suburban wilderness to walk on the wild side of strip malls? Look no further, this place is a hidden gem among the Henrietta elite. Nestled between a Home Depot and a Marshall's, this burger palladium overlooks a five story office building devoid of any names or interesting qualities. The mystery view is yours to devour while you sink your paws into a slab of meat embedded between two pads of white bread half the radius of your own skull.  The staff will greet you at the door if they can be bothered to look up from their phone where they are undoubtedly snap chatting Brad. There's always a Brad and you either know him or want to be him. These people KNOW Brad, YOU do not know Brad. You can have a Coke.  Their restaurant is filled with screaming children and Americana memorabilia. No matter what time or day... a group of servers is clapping and screaming for someone's birthday. The insane performance comes with a uhaul of ice cream followed by Walter Brimley presenting you with a diabetic meter and free test strips.  Try their onion tower, smells like heart disease fried in veggie oil, tastes like America.

Was craving a burger, unfortunately this wasn't the place to do it. The hostess was an older woman not very welcoming or friendly just dropped our menus off at the table and walked away. Our waitress however was awesome! Very informative and helpful. Got a bacon cheeseburger and it just wasn't  flavorful. It wasn't gross but didn't satisfy me especially for the price.The garlic fries they have are really good, I'd suggest those over the plain ones. Won't be back but they all can't be winners.
Kathleen was an exceptional server! We always love coming here, everything was good except they put cheese on my royal burger, cooks error!

Okay. I probably should have known better but I'd never been to Red Robin and was curious about their "gourmet burgers". I blame tv advertising for luring me with unrealistic images. First impressions: the place has a sort of crowded layout, and the floor is so dirty it's slippery with that slick greasy residue you get on tile that has never seen soap. The table was greasy, had crumbs on it and so did the seat. My husband had an "I told you so" look on his face as we "slipped" into our booth. Even the salt shakers and condiment bottles on the table were greasy. I literally broke out my hand sanitizer once this was pointed out to me. The server was nice, especially once she started listening to me and stopped pushing the appetizer specials. She was also the only server actually working (there were about 5 other waitresses hanging out at the bar area ignoring everyone around them). Looking at the menu, it was busy and tough to figure out, and the prices were listed in the smallest font size known to man. This is because these prices are ridiculously high considering how not fancy this chain seems to be! $14 for a burger with soggy lettuce and meat that tastes like they got it from McDonalds? Nope! The endless fries were reheated, and round two was undercooked. Finally, it turns out we weren't the only ones having trouble with the floors, as the group leaving behind us also stopped to wipe their shoes on the rug on the way out. Needless to say, there will not be a return trip.

Select another restaurant there are lots nearby. The milkshake was melted. The food was cold. It got sent back and manager came out to apologize which was a joke because he was at the table for 3 seconds and he was apologizing to the people across the aisle too .. and at the same time. The waitress thought that friendly made up for poor service .. and did I mention they only had 6 tables of people in the place. When you only have one thing to do .. which is deliver food acceptable for eating .. and by the way this is what you do .. Poor service, poor quality of food, and a filthy greasy floor that needs mopping because you slide across it as you walk through the restaurant and a hostess that was completely missing, leaving guests waiting in the front entrance, ranks as the AVOID AT ALL COST establishment.

Came here on a late afternoon with my boyfriend just wanting to eat something small and the host who brought us to the table said that she was sorry the tables we were being placed in were messy and used the words "retarded people" in front of us. We were both in shock and kept asking each other if we heard that correctly. Hearing the host say that made us feel very insulted. We weren't very sure on how to order as the mini screen on our table didn't have the full menu and even clicking on the button to call a server, no one came to help us for about 15 mins until we had to call over a server who was taking care of another table. We complained about the slow service and how rude the host was being in front of us. We don't know her name but she has blonde hair and tattoos and we gave her a big tip. The manager came to us and apologized about the long wait and the host's rudeness. The manager took out one of the burgers from our bill, and we got out food right away after from the manger himself which I thought was very professional and brings out the vibe that customers are the top priority. We left very happy and didn't change our mind on this place. We would have given his experience a much worse star but the host who helped us and the manager really made this experience very well received.

We come every year with friends as it's an annual tradition. Each year our service continues to decline. Today it took a while to be greeted by our server and even longer to get drinks.  When I received my wine, the glass was filthy and had lipstick stains in it.  We order chips and salsa, when they eventually did come the chips were burnt. Thought it was fairly busy no one seemed concerned that these things happened to us. We came to the conclusion that we will not come back. I'm sad because sometimes the food  is actually really good!

Well, it certainly looks like other reviewers are not happy with this location either of late. My cousins and I went there for lunch based on my recommendation - my husband and I have been there a number of times over the years. ABOMINABLE service, both on the part of the waitress and the manager I flagged down to complain about the wait for our orders - I've sent an email to corporate outlining today's fiasco. Oh and the fries were soggy too - yuck. I/we won't be going back any time soon!! DO NOT waste your time and money on this place - they really need to be shut down!!

I was craving a really good hamburger and fries so my son and I went out tonight for dinner. Very disappointing experience. The hostess forgot to seat us, so when people that came in after us were seated before us I checked in again. She got us seated in what is probably the worst table. Super small next to kitchen.  Hamburger was ok. Nothing like the picture depicted. I was hoping for big burger with great flavor and I got an over cooked thin dry patty.  The endless fries were cold and overdone. I think that's on purpose so you don't actually want to order more.  With all of the choices of restaurants I would not ever go back. I could spend half as much at Wendy's and it would be better.
Pretty good food, and better decor at this location in comparison to Webster....We will be back.

We have dined here many times over the years but tonight was a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.After being seated, I noticed the table next to us hadn't been cleared from the last customer. It remained filthy during our entire dinner. The men's bathroom was filthy, garbage overflowing obviously hadn't been cleaned all day. The burgers were overcooked and smaller than in the past. A truly bad experience, we will not return and don't recommend this place. Many other choices in the area.

When did this turn low class???!!?  All my kids were given coloring menus with no crayons. Our server came over and said are you ready to order, I replied that we just sat down. Asked for crayons, she says they are all out. Didn't even offer pens for the kids to draw. Two min later asked again if we were ready, what's the rush? Place is dead empty. Say at far end and heard cooks and waitresses yelling jokes at each other from front to back kitchen. Holy Crap did this place go downhill from years ago. Keep driving!! No water refills. Two kids meals missing sauces and lemons that were in the pic. Had to ask for the tarter sauce for fish! Heard another waitress tell our waitress, "now I remember why I hate serving". This place is pure trash!!! McDonald's would have been a 5 Star restaurant compared to our experience.

My mother requested a birthday dinner from here as she hadn't been in a long time.  We were seated in a booth, right outside the bar area. No wait and not busy. After being seated by the host, we wait a solid 10 minutes before anyone stopped by. No apology was given for the long wait. Our complete order was taken by a bartender whom I observed was busy with to go orders. The appetizer was brought out quickly and hot. That was the only good part. After that, drinks went empty and when eventually replenished, empty cups were not removed. Thirty minutes after with no explanation why the two entrees were taking so long, I gave up and asked for a manager. The food was delivered while our table was a mess with appetizer dishes. The food runner looked at me as she had no where to put my food down. Right as the food was delivered, manager Chris showed up. I told Chris that the service was horrible and we were there for a birthday dinner. He asked for us to enjoy our food while it was hot and he would "figure something out." Chris never returned to the table. While the food was very poor in quality (extreme lack of toppings and looked nothing like pictures), it was later in the evening and we were hungry. The server became a bit more attentive once I informed her I involved a manager, however, she still never offered an apologize for anything. When I paid on the Zoosk, I learned one of our entrees was deleted - we were still responsible for the appetizer, drinks and one entree. It would have been nice for Chris to stop by one more time and/or inform us of what he did to help out and/or acknowledge my mother's birthday in some fashion for guest recovery. But he and his team failed full circle. I was visiting from out of state and my mother certainly will not be returning or recommending. Awful visit.

Always my favorite place to visit when I'm in Henrietta, the service is great at this particular location. Love the food and atmosphere! Highly recommend (Make sure you get some campfire sauce to have with your bottomless fries!!!)

Red Robin is the burger hub when it comes to chain restaurants. It's a mainstay in Henrietta and with their typical burger fair menu, you can't go wrong with any choice. I typically go here for lunch and the the lunch crowd isn't extensive. The large seating area past the bar provides a lot of extra room for larger parties. The service is always incredibly friendly and helpful as well.  If I'm in the mood for a serious burger, I would look elsewhere. However, for lunch or a quicker bite to eat, Red Robin checks those boxes.  Also fries. Bottomless fries.
